abstract: Equity markets were helped by reassurances that Greece was not likely to lose its credit rating, despite its struggle to rein in spending as it deals with a deficit crisis.
snippet: Equity markets were helped by reassurances that Greece was not likely to lose its credit rating, despite its struggle to rein in spending as it deals with a deficit crisis.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve’s decision to keep interest rates near zero helped lead the Dow Jones industrial average to a sixth day of gains on Tuesday. But the enthusiasm was restrained, disappointing those who had hoped low rates would give the market reason for a new upward thrust.

headline.main: Steady Fed Policy Provides Scant Impetus for Investors
headline.print_headline: Steady Fed Policy Provides Scant Impetus for Investors
